meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be filtered.
meanings.sent1: The filterabilities of the coffee machine ensure a smooth and clean brew.
meanings.sent2: The filterabilities of the water pitcher help remove impurities for safe drinking.
meanings.sent3: I never knew the filterabilities of my mind could be so easily influenced by catchy jingles.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as a filterabilities, letting in only positivity and blocking out negativity.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's shield had filterabilities, allowing only good intentions to pass through.

meanings.definition: The ability to pass through a filter.
meanings.sent1: The tiny particles had filterabilities that allowed them to pass through the sieve.
meanings.sent2: The filterabilities of the fabric made it ideal for air to flow through easily.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the filterabilities of the handkerchief disappearing into thin air.
meanings.sent4: His words had filterabilities, smoothly passing through the crowd and leaving an impact.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight's filterabilities through the leaves created a beautiful pattern on the ground.
